This is no small task, but it is further complicated by both the fact that Lucifer hides behind many faces and that there are those--one very strange man, in particular--who would prefer Ghost Rider cease his mission immediately...or else.
name: Vicious Cycle: Part 2

description: The Devil has been set loose on earth and it's Johnny Blaze's - the Ghost Rider's - fault. Determined to atone for his careless actions, Blaze has vowed to track down Lucifer and send The Devil back to where he came from. Dr. Strange, however, has different plans - advising Ghost Rider to cease and desist, immediately. But why? And will Johnny take Dr. Strange's advice? Here's a hint: Has Johnny ever taken anyone's advice?
name: Vicious Cycle: Part 3

description: Ghost Rider's trail of vengeance leads him to a crushing realization: It may be impossible for him to thwart Lucifer's plan to consolidate power on earth...because Ghost Rider is part of the plan! Will Ghost Rider follow Dr. Strange's advice and turn away from vengeance? More importantly, can he?
name: Vicious Cycle: Part 4

description: Once upon a time, Johnny Blaze had a wife, a family and his own carnival-everything a stunt-riding yahoo could ever want. Then it all went to Hell...literally. Now back on Earth, Johnny has one last chance to reconcile his life before he has to immerse himself in death. Featuring a guest appearance by...SATAN!
name: The Day Johnny Came Home

description:
How did Johnny Blaze end up in Hell, anyway? It's simple, really: He died. And when he died, his eternal soul--long promised to Hell in exchange for "saving" Crash Simpson--descended into the Pit, taking the Ghost Rider along with it. This is the story of how and why it all happened.

A group of extreme catholics gather at a pond for a boys baptisim. All of a sudden the main priest holds the boy under the lake for to long and dies. Ghost Rider appears to avenge the boy. The priest turns out to be Lucifer. He tries to hit Lucifer with his chain but he slams him in a tree knocking him out.

Johnny Blaze wakes up with a cop hovering over him. Unaware of what is going on, the cop knocks Blaze out with his club.

He gets sent back to a jail where he meets up with another felon who was caught in the middle of the killing of a bartender. the felon knows Johnny is a Ghost Rider.

Meanwhile Ghost Rider is still fighting Lucifer. He punches Ghost Rider down but he gets back up and Ghost Rider spits a big ball of fire charing Lucifer. But Lucifer gets back up. He rips of Ghost Rider's leg and continously beats him with it.

The next day Blaze gets out of jail and meets the other felons lawyer who needs Blaze's help.
name: Hell to Pay: Part 1

description: Meanwhile, in the present, Ghost Rider knows what needs to be done. The problem is that there's something-someone-holding him back…and it's not Lucifer. It's Johnny Blaze. Will Johnny step aside and let Ghost Rider loose to do what he's meant to do? And should he? After all, it didn't do him any good in the past-as a matter of fact it's what damned him to Hell…both when he first summoned the Ghost Rider and then again, years later, on the day Johnny Blaze died.
name: Hell to Pay: Part 2

description: The Five Wives plan to take their deadly revenge on The Punisher. To bring the wolf to their door, all they need is bait.
name: Widowmaker: Part 2

description: Five women, linked by tragedy... and obsession. The Punisher killed their husbands -- put them down like dogs -- and shattered their lives. Now they want payback... and they've hatched the perfect plan to get it.
name: Widowmaker: Part 1

description: Despite being boxed in, outmanned and outgunned, Frank Castle stared down General Nikolai Alexandrovich Zakharov, "The Man of Stone," ready to resolve unfinished business. Now, stranded in the mountains of Afghanistan, Frank contemplates the two promises he's made to Kathryn O'Brien. One he's already kept. The other, he's about to. This is more than just punishment...it's payback.
name: Man of Stone: Part 6

description:
Punisher's confrontation with The Man of Stone races towards its fatal conclusion!

The Punisher comes face to face with the man of stone.
name: Man of Stone: Part 5

description: It's high noon in the mountains of Afghanistan. As Frank Castle and his ragtag crew of mercenaries square off against General Nikolai Alexandrovich Zakharov - a.k.a. "The Man of Stone" - and a battalion of Russian Marines. The Punisher is boxed in, outmanned - just the way he likes it.
name: Man of Stone: Part 4

description:
General Zakharov has returned to the scorched plains of Afghanistan with one thing in mind: Revenge on the man with whom he played chicken on the grandest scale. That man is Frank Castle -- a.k.a. the Punisher -- and he also knows a thing about resolve.

The mountains of Afghanistan. It's here that General Nikolai Alexandrovich Zakharov got his nickname: "Man of Stone." While bullets bounced off the rocks at his feet and hardened men scrambled for cover, Zakharov stood his ground. And what he did next -- what he did next has haunted the dreams of the mujahideen ever since. What he did next showed them the depths of his resolve. That was years ago. Now, General Zakharov has returned to these scorched plains with one thing in mind: Revenge on the man with whom he played chicken on the grandest scale. That man is Frank Castle -- a.k.a. the Punisher -- and he, too knows a thing about resolve.
name: Man of Stone: Part 3

description:
When a mutual enemy of Castle comes with the perfect plan to lure Frank out of his hole, Zakharvo is all ears. That man is Rawlins. His bait? His former wife -- and sometime Castle flame: O'Brien.

The last time General Nikolai Alexandrovich Zakharov encountered Frank Castle, the two men were playing chicken with a dozen nuclear warheads over Moscow. Since then, well, let's just say Zakharov's not the type to forgive and forget. When a mutual enemy of Castle comes with the perfect plan to lure Frank out of his hole, Zakharvo is all ears. That man is Rawlins. His bait? His former wife -- and sometime Castle flame: O'Brien.
name: Man of Stone: Part 2

description:
The last time General Zakharov encountered Frank Castle, the two men were playing chicken with a dozen nuclear warheads over Moscow. Since then, well, let's just say Zakharov's not the type to forgive and forget.

The last time General Nikolai Alexandrovich Zakharov encountered Frank Castle, the two men were playing chicken with a dozen nuclear warheads over Moscow. Since then, well, let's just say Zakharov's not the type to forgive and forget. When a mutual enemy of Castle comes with the perfect plan to lure Frank out of his hole, Zakharvo is all ears. That man is Rawlins. His bait? His former wife -- and sometime Castle flame: O'Brien.
name: Man of Stone: Part 1

description: What’s more dangerous than a barracuda? You’re about to find out. Off the coast of Florida, where human predators converge to enjoy the spoils of corporate warfare, the water is filled with blood. And none of it belongs to Frank Castle.
name: Barracuda: Part 6

description: Dermot and Alice have got a big problem. He weighs 300-pounds -- give or take a severed body part or two, incurred during his recent skirmish with the Punisher. He goes by the name of Barracuda. And he wants some payback. If the villainous pair is going to have any chance at survival, then their only hope just might be the man they tried to kill in the first place.
name: Barracuda: Part 5

description: Frank Castle has definitely seen better days. Beaten to within an inch of his life, then handcuffed and tossed into the Deep Blue Sea, he’s got a Great White bearing down on him. If he’s going to survive, he’s going to have to think quick. And then he’s got to worry about who’s waiting for him on the surface: The Barracuda. And he can’t wait for Round Two.
name: Barracuda: Part 4

description: If you think Frank’s brawl with the Russian was nasty, you ain’t seen nasty. Because Frank Castle’s never thrown down with anyone like the Barracuda before. When these two stone killers mix it up, they’ll engage in a battle that leaves no rule unbroken, no bone unbroken. And what’s waiting for the loser is even worse: some private time in the deep blue sea with a Great White shark!
name: Barracuda: Part 3

description: For most men, Frank Castle is the ultimate game. But for a stone-cold predator like the Barracuda, Frank Castle ain’t nothing but a snack.
name: Barracuda: Part 2

description: Jigsaw, Ma Gnucci, the Russian -- Frank Castle’s faced some fearsome foes in his day, but none as stone-cold rotten to the bone as The Barracuda. He’s big, he’s mean, and the last thing on earth you want is to see him smile.
name: Barracuda: Part 1

description: The death of Drax and we're not kidding. Not a crossover stunt, not a sales gimmick, not a hackneyed plot device. In this issue Drax dies... bites the big one... shuffles off the ol' mortal coil... You get the picture. And wait till you see who lands the death blow!
name: Illegal Aliens

description: An entire town is enslaved by escaped Extraterrestrial convicts who want nothing more than to be gone before any of Earth’s super-powered defenders know that they were ever there. Their concerns are misplaced. Drax has been reborn and is out to settle the score with anyone who’s ever crossed him. Not a good day to be an escaped extraterrestrial convict.
name: From the Ashes

description: Drax has been reborn bad and is out for some long overdue payback, starting with the three aliens who killed him two issues back. We know, we know, that last doesn't make a lot of sense unless you've read the previous issues of Drax...which you SHOULD HAVE! What? You think I'm writing this for my health?
name: Hard penance

description: He took away their husbands, and they want payback. Five mob wives unveil their plan to take down the Punisher. But a new player moves onto the field -- one they hadn't anticipated. And she's got plans of her own.
name: Widowmaker: Part 3

description:
Searching for a retrovirus that could bring the world to its knees, Frank Castle penetrates a Russian nuclear silo!

Frank Castle is trapped in a nuclear missile silo in Sudhek, Russia. He's undertaken a mission for Nick Fury to preserve a sample of a lethal biological agent and safely transport it to an extraction point. What he didn't know going in was that the biological weapon was in the bloodstream of a six-year-old girl. To further complicate matters, a Russian military unit has arrived on the scene and are determined to flush him out.
name: Mother Russia: Part 4

description:
After breaking into a Russian nuclear silo, Frank Castle comes face-to-face with the Mongolian!

Frank Castle is unconscious at the bottom of a missile silo in Sudhek, Russia. He's there to rescue a six-year-old girl with a deadly biological agent in her blood and take her back to the U.S., a mission he's undertaken at the behest of Nick Fury. Things are looking grim for Frank after the silo is infiltrated by an agent of General Zakharov - the only man in the Russian Military who understands the stakes in this situation. To have any hope of getting out, Frank has to figure out a way to be Zakarov's super-agent and sneak out a of a missile complex with one exit past a Russian Military unit.
name: Mother Russia: Part 5

description:
The blood-soaked conclusion to MOTHER RUSSIA: It's missiles over Moscow as Frank Castle looks to destroy a deadly retrovirus buried deep in the bowels of a Russian missile silo.

Frank Castle's game of brinkmanship with General Zakharov reaches its zenith with Frank threatening to launch nuclear missiles at Russian cities unless given safe passage from the missile complex. They've got three minutes to reply before the first missile launches. Zakharov suspects that it's all a bluff. That the Americans in the silo do not possess the will to kill millions of innocents and he's ready to call Frank Castle's bluff.....
name: Mother Russia: Part 6

description:
Super-gangster Nicky Cavella is back with a vengeance. This time, he'll hit Frank Castle where he least expects it: right in the black pit of his hardened heart.

In the first installment of Up is Down, Black is White, Frank is subject to a new kind of warfare; Psychological. There aren't many people out there who can play mind games with the Punisher, and get anywhere with it. But, when Nicolas Cavella defiles his families grave, Cavella becomes two things; The first man to ever succeed in playing mind games with the Punisher, and, of course, the last person to ever attempt to play mind games with the Punisher, but of course, the latter doesn't occur until issue six.
name: Up Is Down and Black is White: Part 1

story_arc_credits.name: Up is Down and Black is White

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Up is Down and Black is White

description:
With one unspeakable act, Nicky Cavella will go right to the top of Frank's to-do list, and there's nowhere he'd rather be.

In this second installment of Up is Down, Black is White, we learn much more about the defiler of the Castle grave site, Nicolas Covella. We learn he killed most of his family, had an incestuous relationship with his aunt, and eventually killed his aunt, all of this on his way to taking over as the head of his family, and his way to insanity. Nicolas's rise to his position of power is also followed via flashbacks.

Oddly enough, all we see of The Punisher in this issue is a news picture.
name: Up Is Down and Black is White: Part 2

story_arc_credits.name: Up is Down and Black is White

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Up is Down and Black is White

description:
If Frank is going to survive Nicky Cavella's return, he just might need a little help...from a secret admirer.

After the discovery of his families grave's desecration, The Punisher goes on a real rampage.
name: Up Is Down and Black is White: Part 3

story_arc_credits.name: Up is Down and Black is White

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Up is Down and Black is White

description:
Planet Earth. Inhabited by six billion people. People leading ordinary lives, coping with everyday struggles. But on a night like any other, the Earth is rocked by the most startling celestial event ever witnessed by the human race. The White Event. And from its wake, a handful of humans emerge as something more.

We meet many of the characters from the original New Universe, but re-imagined. Ken Connell and Madeline Felix (now smarter and blonde) live in Oklahoma. They are young and hanging out in a meadow after a night of partying.

Izanami Randall leaves a bar in San Francisco.

Detective John Tensen lies in the hospital after being shot in the head.

The White Event happens, and they are all affected. Izanami gets the powers of Nightmask and sees the reality of dreams.

Tensen wakes up, kills the nurse who had come into the room as a mercy killer, and becomes a new Justice.

Some archaeologists find a previously-unknown ruin in Latvia, including a skeleton showing the diagram of the Star Brand on its head.

Ken wakes up and finds himself in a giant Star Brand mark burned into the meadow, with Maddie's burned body beside him. He calls the police (her dad is the chief). They arrest him and her dad threatens to kill him, but at that moment, the Star Brand on his hand lights up.
name: Enter

description:
The plot thickens when Nicky Cavella enlists the services of the shadowy rogue op and force of nature known as Rawlins.

Castle slips further and further into his violent state of mind.

Note: this issue features one of the most important moments in The Punishers entire history, as a simple set of panels shows who Frank Castle REALLY wants to kill.
name: Up Is Down and Black is White: Part 4

story_arc_credits.name: Up is Down and Black is White

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Up is Down and Black is White
